metadata.title: CVE-2015-3200 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: mod_auth in lighttpd before 1.4.36 allows remote attackers to injectarbitrary log entries via a basic HTTP authentication string without acolon character, as demonstrated by a string containing a NULL and new linecharacter.

criterions.comment: lighttpd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
